Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
model.Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
This class represents the Store's inventory of parts and products. Its methods are designed to add to, remove from, update, and search through its inventory. For a class this important, this was easy and relatively quick to code.

  • Method Details

    • addPart

      public static void addPart(Part part)
      This method adds a part to the list of parts in the Inventory.
      Parameters:
      part - The part to be added.

    • addProduct

      public static void addProduct(Product product)
      This method adds a product to the list of products in the Inventory.
      Parameters:
      product - The product to be added.

    • lookUpPart

      public static Part lookUpPart(int partID)
      This method returns the part associated with a particular ID. It iterates through the list of all the parts looking for a part that matches that ID. If it finds it, it returns that part. If it cannot find it, it returns null.
      Parameters:
      partID - The part ID to be searched for
      Returns:
      The part associated with partID if found, null if not

    • lookUpPart

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> lookUpPart(String partName)
      LOGICAL ERROR This method returns the list of parts whose names contain a particular String. It iterates through the list of parts looking for those that match. It adds them to a new list, then returns that list. A logical error I ran into occurred while writing this method. Initially I was searching in a case-sensitive manner. But often when people are searching, they will search in lowercase even if there might be some part of their desired result that is in uppercase. So I made sure to convert both the names of both the part you are looking for and the parts you are comparing to to lowercase so that you don't have to worry about cases when searching.
      Parameters:
      partName - A portion of the name of the part(s) you are looking for.
      Returns:
      The list of parts whose names contain the name you were looking for.

    • lookUpProduct

      public static Product lookUpProduct(int productID)
      This method returns the product associated with a particular ID. It iterates through the list of all the products looking for a product that matches that ID. If it finds it, it returns that product. If it cannot find it, it returns null.
      Parameters:
      productID - The product ID to be searched for
      Returns:
      The product associated with productID if found, null if not

    • lookUpProduct

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> lookUpProduct(String productName)
      This method returns the list of products whose names contain a particular String. It iterates through the list of products looking for those that match. It adds them to a new list, then returns that list.
      Parameters:
      productName - The product name to be searched for
      Returns:
      The list of products containing that name

    • updatePart

      public static void updatePart(int index, Part selectedPart)
      This method replaces a part at a particular index on the list of parts with a new part.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the part to be replaced
      selectedPart - The part that will replace the old one

    • updateProduct

      public static void updateProduct(int index, Product selectedProduct)
      This method replaces a product at a particular index on the list of product with a new product.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the product to be replaced
      selectedProduct - The product that will replace the old one

    • deletePart

      public static boolean deletePart(Part selectedPart)
      FUTURE ENHANCEMENT This method deletes a part from the list of parts. The program requirements state that a product cannot be deleted when it has associated parts. One future enhancement to the program would be to make it so a part cannot be deleted while it is associated with products, as the parts are used to make the products they are associated with. You wouldn't want a part in an associated parts list that is no longer in the inventory's list of parts.
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - The part to be deleted
      Returns:
      Returns true if deletion success, false if failure

    • deleteProduct

      public static boolean deleteProduct(Product selectedProduct)
      This method deletes a product from the list of product.
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - The product to be deleted
      Returns:
      Returns true if deletion success, false if failure

    • getAllParts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> getAllParts()
      This method returns the list of parts in the Inventory.
      Returns:
      The list of parts in the Inventory

    • getAllProducts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> getAllProducts()
      This method returns the list of products in the Inventory.
      Returns:
      The list of products in the Inventory

    • getNextPartID

      public static int getNextPartID()
      This method returns the ID of a new part to be added, after incrementing the ID from the last part. This method is necessary to keep track of the part IDs used, as even after a part is deleted its ID cannot be reused. Incrementing this after each part allows every ID to be unique and used only once.
      Returns:
      The ID of the next part to be created.

    • partCanceled

      public static void partCanceled()
      This method undoes getNextPartID()'s incrementing of the ID of the next part, as that part's creation was canceled.

    • getNextProductID

      public static int getNextProductID()
      This method returns the ID of a new product to be added, after incrementing the ID from the last product. This method is necessary to keep track of the product IDs used, as even after a product is deleted its ID cannot be reused. Incrementing this after each product allows every ID to be unique and used only once.
      Returns:
      The ID of the next product to be created.

    • productCanceled

      public static void productCanceled()
      This method undoes getNextProductID()'s incrementing of the ID of the next product, as that product's creation was canceled.
